result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn T Witt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Repeater (During 72 Hour No Contact Period)], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.05(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 817 days for TIME SERVED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution of $600.00 to Crime Victim Compensation Fund (along with surcharges) as a Condition of Extended Supervision. No more than 25% of his prison wages.

AS OF 10/31/2016: Restitution was corrected to $600.00

Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision - to be paid out of 25% of prison funds.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Not to operate a MV unless he has a valid license.
No contact with: Virgina Redlin, Thomas Redlin, Jean Stafford, Karalee Volenti, Karisa Fendl, Debra Moll, Janice Doerr, Scott Brook, Matthew Barker, Alice Anibas and Dorothy Anibas.

Sentencing hearing at 04-18-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Shawn T Witt in court, in custody, with attorney Anthony Cotton for Donna Jean Kuchler.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Argument by Atty. Boese on why the court should accept the amended information.  Atty. Cotton makes no additional argument.  Court accepts the amended information.  
Mr. Witt does not object to having Anthony Cotton his counsel for today's hearing.  

Plea Colloquy.  Mr. Witt enters a no contest plea to Count 1.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Remaining Counts are dismissed and read in.  

Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.  Body armor warnings given. 

State informs there will be $600 in restitution that will be requested at sentencing. 
  
Parties request a PSI.  Court orders a PSI.

granting the motion in limine   signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 1-20-16

Defendant Shawn T Witt in court, in custody, with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case called for the State's motion in limine.  Parties do not object there are 2 prior convictions (Jefferson County 08CT331 - OWI 2nd and Jefferson County 08CT622 - OWI 3rd)
Argument by Atty. Boese that the convictions can come in at trial.  Argument objecting by Atty. Kuchler.  Rebuttal by Atty. Boese.  
Court grants the motion in limine for reasons stated on the record. Convictions may be used at trial and will give an instruction on it.

At trial 2 alternates will be picked.  Each side has 7 strikes.  Jurors may take notes.  Certain instructions will ve read prior to opening statements.  Parties to have proposed instructions by 02-05-2016 to be reviewed at the jury status.  Parties to pre-mark exhibits.  State to use numbers.  Defense to use letters.  Parties to prepare exhibit list.  

State notes they have 40 witnesses.  Statements by the court.  

All charges in this case will be tried to the jury.  14CM110 will follow but not be tried to the jury.

Pursuant to 15-SO-14 (67) Rotation Judicial Assignment Order
Oral ruling on October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

State's Exhibits #3 & 4 and Defense Exhibits A-J.

Defense Exh K is a DVD and not scannable and will be kept in the file room.

Defendant Shawn T Witt in court, in custody, with Attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's exhibits #3 & 4 marked.  Case called for continued motion hearing. Defense calls witness.  Retired detective Terry Tesch is sworn-in and testifies.  Defense Exhibits A-J (photos) are marked.  Attorney Kuchler shows photos on video document camera in courtroom.  Cross-examination by the state.  Re-direct by Attorney Kuchler.  Re-cross-examination by the state.  Defense rests.  Court closes testimony on search motion.  Court will hear suppression of statements motion.  Detective Robert Wepfer is sworn-in and testifies.  Cross-examination by Attorney Kuchler. Re-direct by the state.  State plays part of DVD interview of Defendant.  Court recesses at 12:15 p.m. and will reconvene at 1:30 p.m.   Defense Exhibit K (DVD) is marked.  Court reconvenes at 1:45 p.m.  Attorney Kuchler continues with re-cross-examination.  Attorney Kuchler moves for admission of Exhibit K.  State stipulates as to contents and time frame on DVD (Exhibit K).  Exhibit K is received.  State moves for admission of Exhibits #3 & 4.  Court receives Exhibits #3 & 4.  State rests.  Attorney Kuchler requests that the court review DVD submitted (Exhibit K).  Court will review on its own time (2 hour DVD).  Court orders parties to submit briefs by September 1, 2015.  Any rebuttal briefs are due by October 2, 2015.  Court sets case for oral ruling.    Bail remains as fixed.
Exhibit 1 and 2 scanned

Stipulation and Order for Return of Exhibits signed and filed.  Exhibits shall be disposed of pursuant to the signed Stipulation and Order and based on the retention period for exhibits in SCR 72.01(46).  Biological material collected in connection with the action shall be disposed of pursuant to the retention period for exhibits in section 757.54, Wis. Stats.
Motion hearing on July 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shawn T Witt in court, in custody, with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler and Justin Singleton.   Lesli S Boese  and Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders witness sequestered.
Officer   Butina sworn and questioned on direct by Atty. Boese.  Cross by Atty. Kuchler.
Officer  Falkner sworn and questioned on direct by Atty. Boese.  Cross by Atty. Kuchler.  Redirect by Atty. Boese.  
Officer Best sworn and questioned on direct by Atty. Boese.  Court takes recess.  Case continues at 10:34.  Continued direct by Atty. Boese.  Cross by Atty. Kuchler.  Redirect by Atty. Boese.   Recross by Atty. Kuchler.  Redirect by Atty. Boese.  
Officer Hazelton sworn and questioned on direct by Atty. Boese.  Court recesses at 12:17  Case reconvenes at 2:09.  Officer Hazelson continues on the stand on direct.  Cross by Atty. Kuchler.  Redirect by Atty. Boese.  Recross by Atty. Kuchler.  Redirect by Atty. Boese.  Recross by Atty. Kuchler.  Redirect by Atty. Boese. Recross by Atty. Kuchler.  State rests.
Court takes recess.  Court reconvenes.
Officer Borchardt sworn and questioned on direct by Atty. Kuchler. Cross by Atty. Boese.  Redirect by Atty. Kuchler.  Recross by Atty. Boese.  

Atty. Kuchler requests photos of the front door be admitted.  Atty. Boese objects as they are not testified to.  Atty. Kuchler then states she is not resting and would like to introduce them.  Court will adjourn to July 1, 2015.  Atty. Boese state there should be no rebuttal testimony.  Court removes the case from the trial calendar.  Court will set briefing schedule at the end of the next hearing.
